Key Match Events: Justyn-Henry Malloy’s eighth-inning sacrifice fly helped the Detroit Tigers rally from a 3-0 deficit to win 4-3.
Riley Greene singled off Garrett Cleavinger and Matt Vierling drew a walk in the eighth inning.
Colt Keith tied the game with an RBI single in the eighth inning.
Malloy lifted a fly ball to medium center, and Vierling easily beat Jose Siri’s throw.
Beau Brieske got the win with two innings of relief, and Jason Foley pitched the ninth for his 27th save.
The Rays took a 2-0 lead in the third inning with a two-out base hit by Brandon Lowe.
Walls tripled with one out in the fifth and scored on Casey Mize’s wild pitch.
Hunter Bigge walked Vierling with two outs before Keith hit an RBI triple in the sixth inning.
Kevin Kelly pitched a perfect seventh inning, extending his scoreless streak to 23⅓ innings over 25 outings.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch expressed belief in the team's momentum and accomplishments.
Rays manager Kevin Cash commented on the Tigers' momentum and the Rays' need to sweep their season-ending series against the Red Sox.
Rookie Colt Keith expressed love for the team and their current energy.
